Create a playlist Video playlists separate your videos to make the video more consumer-friendly for first-time visitors. Another advantage of playlists is that people can switch to more videos after watching the first video. Create a list of subcategories of people who watch your channel and cater to each group. This kind of personalization is essential in making people sign up. Customized human thumbnail The best way to ensure people playing your video is by using the image of a person who is laughing directly with eye contact as a thumbnail for your video. Your video thumbnail is essentially the cover of your video, so you need it completely beyond the appeal. Actually, I think video thumbnails are the most important thing that determines whether visitors are playing or not playing your video. Co-marketing YouTube is a great avenue to co-brand your brand with another company. Co-marketing has become a helpful strategy for many businesses trying to increase the number of viewers and subscribers to YouTube. Partnering with big-name brands has a tremendous growth privilege. However, you can not just hit Target and video marketing requirements. Be yourself People may like to consume your content because you are humorous, intelligent, witty, humble, generous, kind or foolish. Insert any qualities you have here. If you have created previous videos for your online courses, go back and see them. Focus on maintaining consistency with everything you release for public consumption. Ask your friends and your network to share it.  Email them and say, "I'm building this new thing and I want to reach more people who will find this useful. Email and referrals are two of the best ways to grow your subscribers. An email from a trusted source for 5-10 people will generate more subscriptions than a random Facebook post that most of your networks miss.

My advice? Learn from history. YouTube has been around for 12 years now and every “viral” video has a similar theme or something about it that makes it stand out for better or worse. Think down the path of “ridiculousness” .. there is even a TV show by the same name. Do something out of the ordinary.. you need a gimmick that works but not just that it needs to get people laughing or talking. Relate to a life experience of yours or for most people. Make a song, a lot of “Music-Video’s go viral if that’s your aim. Make people like your personality and don’t be “Beta-Cucked” into wanting to people to like you. Be de-sensitized and fearless, perform a stunt that takes bravery into stupidity and act like you don’t care while stirring concern in your audience. Drama is one way to the top, skill is another Generally speaking you are going to need substantial amounts of ca$h/funding to help you setup a rig or “stage” for your act(s). cheap equipment is annoying and going to drive people away. Be dramatic/theatrical. People love enthusiasm and good acting. Remember you want to aim for the stars here so add copious amounts of narcissim/sociopathy to your personality perhaps.. Jake Paul and Onision are great examples to use… leach off of current trends. Stay current. Don’t re-hash and re-brand what’s been and gone, people cotton on to that. I’m not an expert or famous myself but I recognise the “formula”… easier said than done of course.. assuming this is what you want. but the most creative/talented/untalented/brazen people are always a bit crazy. A bit of craziness goes a long way. You need to break-away from the constraints of normality. Learning that polite and introvert doesn’t sell but what money can’t buy is confidence.Think about losing weight and looking good athletic/muscular. Then you are playing the attraction card to get “mega fans”.. Think about leadership skills, never be beta cucked into making a response video for example, get other people to respond to you, therefore asserting yourself as the point of interest. Often it is the case i see that you need to offer something that (most) other people can’t/won’t/don’t do in order to be a “desireable”. But the keys are relatability, likability and/or being over the top. These are winning combinations. Lots of people want more subscribers. Willing but not able, able but not willing. You have to be both and commit to offering the world a service whether that be entertainment, music, political commentary. My father used to tell me “p*** poor planning leads to p*** poor performance. Make a plan and stick to it.

Making a successful YouTube channel requires a lot of hard work and dedication. You also have to spend your time in making a good video. Always remember the phrase “Quality over Quantity”. You’ll first have to decide about which topic will you choose your channel to publish. For Example: FoodHealthGaming and many more.Once you’ve decided, you can make a video about it and add an intro. Try to put a catchy background song, if you’re not speaking. If you’re speaking, you can put a background song at a very low volume. Make sure to put a song at medium volume. (Don’t pull your song at full volume!) And also make sure to put a background music i.e without lyrics, just instrumental. BOOM!! You’ve got basic idea on how to make a successful YouTube channel! Many of you are surely aware of the increasing competition in social networks. Millions of creative people and their imitators are in a tough competition among themselves for the attention of a huge audience, which is then easily monetized. In fact, the number of new and interesting ideas naturally decreases, unlike the growing at an unreasonable pace army of bloggers. You can see this situation more clearly on YouTube than anywhere else. It is caused by both the popularity of the resource itself and the availability of effective tools for a decent income. The times, where any talented person with a fresh idea would suddenly wake up famous, are far behind. And no matter how breakthrough and interesting your product (in the broad sense of the word) is, its popularization without having a decent amount of subscribers became almost impossible.  Most of those who have stepped on this difficult path of YouTube promotion understand it all well. Although, there are some little-known details that can bring down the entire planned strategy. The most dangerous thing is not knowing and not understanding the community for which the video is made for. And those who are sure that their content completely meets the needs of their target audience in most cases have their wishes unfulfilled. The point here is not to feel your potential viewers. It is impossible to absolutely guess what a community wants. At least due to the fact that it is not at all a group of the same people, but it consists of individuals with a unique spectrum of preferences. Subscribers is the main capital of a blogger on YouTube. It's no secret that to sell your product or promote an idea you need to introduce it to as many people as possible. This is an axiom that does not require proof. But in the world of YouTube, having a large number of subscribers has much more meaning. And there are reasons for that: 1. Ranking. A video released by a user with a bigger amount of subscribers takes the first place in the search and recommendation list of unsubscribed users. Naturally, some of them will be interested in the rest of the author’s videos. Thus, we have a “snowball” effect: new fans are attracted because of the large number of the old ones. 2. Psychology. Human psychological attitudes, or more precisely instincts, play the main role here. The fact is that people are more willing to trust those who have more supporters. This is clearly seen in real life in the case of some politicians, whose power rests solely on such “effects”. A good illustration can also be an example of queues in shopping centers. When initially uninterested in buying people come up to see what product attracted so many people’s attention. In other words, in this case the principle is present as well: when you get subscribers, you attract new ones by doing this. And the more you get, the faster your audience grows. 3. Monetization. This point is the easiest to explain. If you get a lot of subscribers on YouTube, your channel is easier to be seen by advertisers. So you have every chance of becoming a product promoter, and for a short mention of it in your video you can get a decent fee. Also, by having a large audience you’ll get advertising payments from YouTube itself. What can you do to increase the number of subscribers yourself? Sharing a link to your video with a subscription offer via other social networks can be more or less effective. The effectiveness of such an action again depends on the amount of subscribers you have on those platforms. If your audience is large there, then you have a decent chance, which cannot be said about those who are just starting to use social networks as an advertising channel. In this case you could use some third-party services, which can help you speed up the process a little bit. Something like http://mrpopular.net would do the trick here, but you could make your own research if you want. However, if you are a little more intricate and much more straightforward, you can try spamming links in the comments below the videos from famous bloggers. But you shouldn’t forget that popular personalities consider themselves to be a separate privileged caste ruling in the open spaces of YouTube, because of which they show much more intolerance to such actions of plebeians. Therefore, in most cases your spam will be immediately blocked along with your account. And it’s a miracle if your account doesn’t get reported. Let me know if you have any questions.

Second: Engage with your subscribers Full disclosure - I worked on this app. The Callmart app is all about putting people in touch and sharing knowledge. This translates well to the realm of YouTube since viewers tend to crave more direct forms of contact with their favorite YouTubers. There are two ways to approach using Callmart: 1) Money-making: Callmart primarily functions to earn you money as a seller of knowledge and your precious time. Essentially, you make money in your free time by offering one-to-one phone calls in the app to buyers interested in connecting with you personally. The app charges buyers the price you decided on a per-minute basis, and you will be paid instantly when a phone call ends. If you have a loyal following on YouTube, then we're sure you could find success using Callmart to connect with subscribers! 2) Channel promotion: Callmart can also uniquely function as an engagement-building app, which means you approach Callmart as a promotional activity primarily, and the money you earn from talking is just a bonus! The quality of each phone call ranks highly while quantity may not be as important to you. By leaving a good impression on viewers, even from chats as short as a few minutes, you can promote yourself and your channel by word-of-mouth, which is a proven way to gain long-term followers. We recommend this approach for YouTubers who are hoping to increase their subscribers and gain more views on videos. You can also take advantage of Social Blade as a way to see where your channel stands among your fellow YouTubers. This means you can measure your growth and compare it to channels of a similar size and theme. I hope this helps! Good luck gaining a bigger following for your YouTube channel.

When I first started my Youtube channel, there were a lot of people saying that the sub for sub method works, but the way Youtube work, it could end up backfiring. So, I decided I would go the organic way. Now, thankfully I work with a company that has a Youtuber who is kind enough to share some of her tips with everyone else and I was able to use three of them to start my own channel. Here are the three things I used to get my first 10 subs in just one month:  Now, there are a few things that I don’t mention in this video and that’s because I’m planning to add them in my next Youtube milestone video, which will be once I hit 50 subs. However, I’m willing to share some of them here. Testing Equipment So, when I started my channel I promised some of my students that I wouldn’t use any more than $100 to do so, meaning I couldn’t get a camera. I did this because no one would believe me when I told them you can start a channel with just your smartphone or laptop camera. So, right now I’m using my phone’s camera to record. As for a mic, I had a mic from when I took a public speaking class, however it didn’t sound so good so I bought a new one. Next, I bought some lighting to help with the quality of my phone’s camera and I’ve played with different lighting positions to see which one I like best. Captions Captions are part of the SEO on Youtube. Youtube provides its own caption, but they usually have a few words mistranscribed, so I have a friend do the caption for me. Consistency I told myself that I would post one video, once a week on Thursday and I was able to do that with the first two videos, but then I missed a day and now I’ve been posting every Friday. Starting a Youtube channel is like working a job, if you’re not consistent then you won’t get very far. Now, once you have a few thousand followers, then you might be able to lax a little. But not too much because people will get bored and leave. Why I don’t use Sub4Sub Now, the reason I don’t use Sub4Sub is that it could actually hurt your chances of getting the 4,000 watch hours you need to become a Youtuber. The way Youtube’s algorithm seems to work is that they send your video to your subscribers first. If your subs aren’t watching your videos, then it goes dead, Youtube won’t promote it to anyone else and it will be pushed all the way down the search results. The chances of your subs watching your videos using this method are very low. So, you very well may reach the 1,000 subs, but if you aren’t getting any views, it’ll only hurt your channel. Lastly, the Sub4Sub method is against Youtube policies and you could lose your channel. Unlike IG, your content is probably done over gruing hours of taping, editing, and optimizing SEO, making it harder to start another Youtube channel if you lose everything.

Video Marketing Tips for the Average Joe Video Marketing is a great way to get more leads and sales, but most find it one of the most difficult things to do. This blog post will help you with a simple structure and format on creating effective videos for your marketing efforts. If you learn how to capitalize on the power of video marketing, you’ll get more exposure for your products or business. Creating videos is inexpensive and remain online forever. If you record a video just once, that video will still be viewed and be selling for you for years to come. YouTube is one of the top 3 websites in the world. Getting an estimated 3 Billion views per day. It only makes sense to capture a piece of that audience. Using YouTube can also help you with your Google rankings since Google owns it and looks at content on their websites more favorably. Video Marketing Tips 1. Introduction Introduce yourself in every video. Don’t assume those watching know who you are. 2. Ask a Question It will help those watching determine if they need to watch your video and your video’s aim should be to answer that question. ” Would you like to make better video’s?” 3. Educate Teach your audience something. This will be the main part of your video. This can be done by providing a solution to a common problem tied into the question you started with. Always provide value to your audience. 4. Call to Action Always have a call to action in your videos. You can tell them to visit your website or capture page. You can ask them to email you if you don’t have a website. One of thethings to consider are branding your video. Place your website on the video or at the very least in the first line of your video’s description. Make it easy for your audience to follow-up with your call to action. Also use effective keywords when tagging your video. Use those keywords in the title and description of the video. Don’t let perfection get in the way of getting started. Like anything else you will get better with practice. Know what you want to accomplish with your video and determine how much time you can devote to your video marketing. You will help your videos reach by sharing them to your different social media accounts. Hope this helps you to give video marketing a try. It can’t help but increase your business success. Get the latest trends  This way, you will be able to get the right picture of what's popular at this moment in the country you live in. However, you can also explore trends popular in other countries. You need to ensure that the new videos you create are not distant from the sound and the relevance of the previous vids on your channel. This is extremely important to keep your current followers. For example, if your vlog is about fitness and diet, there's no problem creating videos about the latest songs, even though the topic is currently in vogue. Optimize your YouTube video for search engines Make sure your YouTube video title includes the keywords your viewers will search for. Then, when you write a video description, make sure to include those keywords / phrases. Do not sacrifice flow or clarity for keyword density. Google rewarded for good content and punished keyword stuffing. Once your YouTube videos show more with search engines, they will also show up better to your viewers as they find your content easier. Each new viewer is a new potential subscriber. Post regularly and consistently Consistency is key, since subscribers will not subscribe if you do not update your channel, or if you update 4 times in a week and then take one month off. If you can update your ongoing series like this, you'll have gold to give subscribers unique video content that not only keeps your current subscribers but also attracts subscribers. new and increase the level of video interaction. Make use of the comments to get more subscribers. Create spreadsheets and valuable document reviews for your channel's development. These are honest reviews that tell you what works and what does not work. The comment section is also a complete goldmine idea for your next vlog. Use your call-to-action  A call-to-action is essential for YouTube videos as they give you the opportunity to turn ordinary viewers into subscribers, potential customers, or even paying customers. Make sure you not only make a call to action to visit your website. Instead, start by asking viewers to share videos only. You do not want to look too hard on the stock, but a simple request can make a big difference.

Click to Action annotations: When you mention your call-to-action, add an image, graphic or "button" to the video, and overlay it with the "Spotlight" annotation that links directly to your channel subscriptions page. In a nutshell, your viewers can now subscribe by clicking on the captions inside your video. Create a script for your video.  Decide what you like to create and focus on developing relevant skills. Do not mimic the trend of YouTube channels. Doing what you love is more important than success on YouTube (and in life). Videos tend to work better if you write scripts because scripts help you streamline your video and get you on the right track. By sticking with a script, you'll be able to keep track of it without having to pay attention to an unrelated topic. This script will also ensure that the perfect event stream leads to a well-focused video. Start playlist Playlists let you divide your videos into categories that provide quick and easy reference for viewers.  This is better than uploading a video only after another video does not have a specific category, making it difficult for viewers to find videos related to a particular topic (like looking for a needle in a haystack). When a person is watching a video that appears in a playlist, this often encourages him to watch more videos, thereby increasing the number of views. Another great benefit of playlists is that they demonstrate your knowledge of persistence in your video. Name your video according to the strategy You have a name in your head, but it can be something complicated or too long. My rule is to stay current and use YouTube's auto-complete feature to name your video. There is nothing wrong with your video having the same name or something that is close to the popular video, as long as the video is relevant.

Participation and participation with this audience goes a long way in promoting not only intimate relationships with current subscribers, but also helps build a deep goodwill. Collaborate with other YouTuber You can contact a YouTuber that you know or want to collaborate and suggest ideas for cross-promotion. A popular approach is to let your proposed partner appear in one of your videos and vice versa, each of you will get endorsement in front of another creator's audience. Channel trailer The channel trailer is a brief introduction about who you are, why your video is valuable and why they should continue to care about what's coming soon. Make sure you talk to each of your buyers in the video. You want your content to speak directly to their pain points and explain how it will solve their problems. I will summarize what has worked for us on The Vegetable Gardening Show GOOD CONTENT I think it goes without saying that you need content that people want to watch. That doesn’t mean you need top of the line equipment. We have filmed some episodes with nothing more than an iPhone 6 and the videos come out great. Whatever it is you are producing, make educational, informative and/or fun. UPLOAD CONSISTENTLY We upload every new videos every Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday. This has helped us tremendously. By uploading multiple episodes per week and uploading them at the same time on each day, our audience knows when new shows will come out and at what times. ASK In your videos don’t be afraid to ask those that are watching to “click the subscribe button”. Adding that our videos has made a huge difference. ENGAGE If someone leaves a comment, be sure to answer that comment, give it a thumbs up and click the new heart icon to let the viewer know that you read their comment. COMMENT Comment on other YouTube channels that you watch. I like to watch other gardening YouTubers and when I see something in their video that I like, or have questions on I am sure to leave a comment to find out more. Others there will see your comment and take notice of your channel. SHARE Be sure to share every video you upload to all of your other social networks. Tweet it out, Facebook it out, put a link on Instagram. Whatever it takes, get the word out about each and everyone of your videos. We like to push ours out to Pinterest and Reddit as well. Hope this helps. Good luck!

Create great content  You can get all your basics and set up an attractive and attractive YouTube channel. However, if your content doesn't provide any value to everyone, you'll have to struggle to increase your YouTube subscribers. Focus on making your video as informative, fun, engaging and entertaining as possible. Remember that the most effective way you can get more YouTube subscribers is when your video starts getting more views. And your current subscribers will be able to watch and review your videos only when they are happy and helpful. Keep your related channels on One of the biggest mistakes I have made in business channels is that they turn off the channel related feature on YouTube. When I talk to the business owner, the reason I get is that they are afraid that their opponent will show up as related channels. By turning off channels of related channels, you also remove yourself from YouTube suggestions. This means that you lose the network effect, making YouTube as strong as it is now. Ads for other videos have screens that end You need to verify your YouTube account to access these features. To do this, click your profile picture at the top right, then click on 'Creator Studio Lau. Next, click on the tab ‘Status and features. Create eye-catching thumbnails  Create custom video thumbnails for each video instead of leaving a randomly generated video. Check the competition and find what kind of thumbnails they have when creating. Make sure your thumbnails are relevant to your content. Try using quality images as thumbnails, give the association that you have a quality video.

The easy answer to this question is that there is no easy way to gain subscribers. But the real easiest way to gain subscribers is the way that you find easy and that works for you. Some channel creators come up with amazing ideas or create unbelievable videos that go viral. If creating this type of video is easy for you, it’s a great way to gain subscribers.Some channel creators are great at using social media, tweeting or posting about videos as they’re published, and getting others to re-tweet, re-post, share, or refer their followers and friends. If you enjoy social media and are able to engage your friends and followers, this could be an easy way to gain subscribers for your YouTube channel.Some channel creators are able to gain subscribers by collaborating with joint venture partners or colleagues in related topic areas who promote the channel. You gain instant credibility if your joint venture partners are well known by your viewers. If you’re comfortable forming partnerships, this could be an easy way to get subscribers.Some channel creators consistently include links to their YouTube channel in their email signature, whenever they post a response, in their LinkedIn profile, and so on. This can be an easy way to gain subscribers. Just be sure you’re not spamming or violating the terms of use where you’re posting.Some channel creators pay for ads on social media, sponsor events, or do speaking engagements. (Caveat: Some people find it easier to spend money to gain subscribers, but you don’t want to go so far as to buy subscribers. That may seem like an easy way to increase your subscriber numbers, but you’ll never know how many people actually like your channel based on your content. It’s also against YouTube’s terms of service.)

You need consistency, and the dedication to see your channel grow. Promotion on social media (Facebook, Snapchat, Twitter, Instagram) will bring potential new subscribers to your channel, and might share it which brings even more. You want your content to be of the same topic or subject. If for instance you are a music channel and that is why your current subs are there for, changing that might cause you to lose them, or potentially gain subs. If you put the time and effort into your content, and you feel proud of what you’ve posted then post it. If you don’t feel proud of it, then retry it, their is no shame in improving your content, if anything, that’ll show your audience you want to be a good Youtuber. Personally, in my time of being a Youtuber, I’ve had channels that’ve died, and one’s that grew to having a large fan base. The one’s that grew were the one’s I truly had passion for, and the ones I put time into. My newest channel, since I stopped posting on Youtube until 2 days ago, is a motivational military channel. If interested the link is at the bottom of the page. I put music over clips of different nations armed forces, and things of the sort, and I’m hoping that people who like the armed forces, are interested in joining, or stuff like that will have fun watching my videos. Military Motivation My First video on the channel:

Start a YouTube Channel YouTube is one of the world’s largest search engines. But, instead of searching for websites, people are looking for entertaining, fun, or informative videos. You can monetize your YouTube channel by using their advertising system or sending your viewers to a website you’ve monetized in another way. You can think of building a YouTube channel in a similar fashion to creating a website, except you’re creating videos, not written content. If you feel comfortable in front of the camera, and want to try your luck creating videos, then you’ll need to figure out what your channel will be about. Typically, there are two types of YouTube channels out there that are most successful: Entertaining content. This style includes content like web series, comedy videos, pranks, reviews, video game walkthroughs, and a lot more.Educational content. This style is more geared towards, “How to” phrases. If you have useful skills or information you want to convey through a video, then this is a solid option for you.Once you’ve decided what kind of channel you’re going to start, it’s time to start creating. First, you’ll need to create a YouTube channel and think of a catchy name. Then, keep the following tips in mind: Use a high-quality camera to record your videosExperiment with different styles, formats, and editing techniques until you find one that gets the most tractionOptimize your video titles, descriptions, and images to get people to clickCreate a consistent video publishing schedule, so followers know when to expect your content

How do I get active subscribers on YouTube? Well first of all don’t think for one moment you can buy ACTIVE subscribers, you might be able to buy an increase in your subscriber count, but ACTIVE… NEVER! This might work but don’t expect to get to the magic thousand overnight: First upload some videos on your channel. Always ask yourself “if this wasn’t my video - would I want to watch it? If you wouldn’t why will other people! Even remove (by making private) any videos that you’re not happy with. Then look for people who have similar interests to yours. And subscribe to their channels, write interesting comments on their channel. I personally always check out any new subscribers and If I like their uploads subscribe back (I feel sure many others do too) Other people will see your comments and check yours out (NEVER ASK THEM TO - it makes you look like a spammer) if those checking out your channel like it, they’ll subscribe, always go to their channel and if you like what you see SUBSCRIBE. When anyone comments on one of your videos reply to them especially if the comment requires an answer, but sometimes “thanks” is enough, This process is known as INTERACTION. (unfortunately too many don’t understand the meaning of the word and think it involves “sub for sub” or spamming on every forum they can find). Ignore many videos explaining how to get subscribers too quickly, I saw one linked to here on Quora explaining how to get 10,000 subscribers quickly. I got no further with that video other than to see the uploader had 43 subscribers, and that video and all his others over the past year or so never got more than about 40 views. “Nuff said☺” It might seem slow at first but enjoy the process, I have many subscribers, some of whom I subscribed back to, from over twelve years ago, that was before anyone could earn anything from YouTube, many still can’t but don’t care.

You’re going to get a lot of varied answers on this question. Here’s a quick tip for sifting through all the advice you’ll get…anyone telling you to focus ONLY on numbers and analytics does not have your best interests in mind. Analytics are ONLY helpful when you’re getting enough traffic to your videos. But you have to have a way to first get traffic to your videos. That being said if you’re willing to shell out some money one of the ways to get traffic fast is to run ads on YouTube for your channel. You can create ads that will show up in the search results or you could shoot your own video ad and have it play before other videos on YouTube (all of this is done via Google Ads). If you don’t want to pay then you need to do a few things: Research your audience and figure out what type of content they want to see. What are they already watching? What can you learn from the videos they’re already watching?Pay for a tool like TubeBuddy or VidIQ (basic plans are like $10/month). Use those tools to research videos on YouTube and what keywords (tags) people are using in your niche. Also do some research to find out what keywords are getting a lot of search volume without a ton of competition on YouTube. Then make videos around those keywords.This might be the MOST important part…Make ENTERTAINING videos. I’ve learned the hard way that you can make the most valuable video on the planet…a video that if people watched and implemented could make them thousands and thousands of dollars…but if it’s not entertaining, they’ll stop watching and move on to the next thing. Entertain and engage your viewers. Keep them watching. And you’ll win.Be consistent. The best thing you can do to grow your channel is to be consistent. Show up every week for the next few years. The biggest fitness channel on YouTube, Fitness Blender, started in 2009. They consistently made videos for THREE years before they had enough traction to really take off and make a big difference on YouTube and in their own lives. Do the work and keep showing up!

response.answer_text: You’re essentially asking “how do I market my content?” You are correct to assume that YouTube itself isn’t going to do much for you (although it will do more if you set the proper/relevant tags while uploading your video - don’t skip that step!) I currently run two YouTube channels. One is for gaming: Malcolm Rose The other is for educating people about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies: https://www.youtube.com/channel/... Both are still pretty small (about 250 and 50 subscribers respectively) but while running them I’ve learned a lot about marketing. The trick is to post your videos in relevant places. If you run a gaming channel, for example, post about your latest videos in subreddits, Discords, forums, etc devoted to the game you’re playing. Obviously be careful to follow the rules - some communities do have rules against excessive advertising (or any advertising at all!) Leverage the power of social media by posting your videos with appropriate hashtags on places like Twitter. Above all, focus on putting out good content. If you are creating quality, generative work, word of mouth will do a lot for you. I also recommend setting up your own webpage if you don’t have one - a website that you control completely which points people towards your work. It doesn’t have to be complicated - mine is pretty simple: RoseCrypto Educational Cryptocurrency Reviews and Guides Having your own webpage will allow people to easily and quickly get an idea of who you are and what you’re doing. Good luck!

If you have a channel on YouTube or just starting on your channel. The first thing you want to grow is your subscribers count. There are many ways to do that. So, here are some tips to help you get more subscribers to your channel. Complete your profile and add your social media profiles Fill out your ‘about’ channel description, set your country and enter a contact email address. Create a Channel Thumbnail, Banner, Categorize your videos, make playlists, and create good titles Organize your channel content with channel sections Create a Channel Trailer for new Viewers Upload consistently Remove old or bad videos Replace outdated content Give viewers a reason to subscribe, something to look forward to Create high-quality videos Keep your video titles short and related to the video End videos with a call to action (subscribe, like, share) Ask friends and family to subscribe and share your videos Share your video on your social media pages Collaborate with other YouTubers Interact with your audience, ask questions, encourage comments Start a blog and share/embed your videos there Do a live stream Promote your channel, not only your videos You can purchase your subscribers Those are primary steps that will help you to earn subscribers. Purchasing subscribers will give you a boost. Only purchase your subscribers from a trustworthy provider - GetFans same withy my provider for my YouTube channel. They provided me, real subscribers, and delivered it gradually that looks so organic. Their customer support is amazing and responsive too.

Hi there! Get more Youtube subscribers seem like a difficult task, but I’ll share some tips to help you get more subscribers: Name Your Videos StrategicallyOne of the most difficult things is to name your video. You have the name in your head, but it may be something complex or too long. My rule is to keep it basic and use the YouTube autocomplete to name the video. There is nothing wrong with your video having the same name or something close to a popular video, as long as it’s relevant. Post Useful Content ConsistentlyThis is one of the most difficult things to do as a content creator. If you take a look around YouTube you might think that every video under the sun has been created and that is most likely true, but you can put your own spin on a popular topic. For example, there are many “unboxing” tech videos…what if you created a “reboxing” and talk about the various components of tech while you put it back in the box? The key here is creativity and that will certainly boost subscriptions. Shoot In Various LocationsI believe that shooting in various locations can lead to more interest. I understand that may not be possible or you may have a set, but try to change a background or even use a green screen. Like the cliché says, “variety is the spice of life” so mix it up with your backgrounds and locations. Spruce Up Your Channel DesignMost visitors first impression of you is from your channel and your design. This is where visitors interact and get to know what you are about. Create a engaging header and show off your brand. Show Your Lighter SideLighten up and laugh at yourself. Bloopers make you more human and show something different than an ordinary talking head video. Also, switch up the video and catch your viewers off guard so they don’t know what to expect. Ask For SubscribersThis is very basic. At the end of every video ask viewers to “like” and subscribe to your channel. You should also tell them why they should subscribe, for example if you are a DIY Home Improvement channel I would say, “subscribe for my DIY projects, tricks and insider tips delivered to you weekly.” Remember, be careful what you ask for, because you might get it. Create A Custom ThumbnailI have seen my subscriptions and views increase by adding this step. I use impact font that is seen on many internet photos to grab attention and I format the photo using Adobe Photoshop. I usually title the photo thumbnail differently than the video because when people are scrolling through other videos to view, they can easily tell what my video is about. Use AnnotationsAnnotations are those annoying things that pop up during videos, but they can be a content creator’s dream. I add annotations to every video and make it easy by creating a link for them to subscribe. This is extra work, but once you see your subscription rate increase you will continue to add them to every video. Be YourselfYou are the best you—you can be. Being on camera was difficult for me at first because I compared myself to others who are natural on camera talent then I realized, “I just have to be me.” Let your personality shine in your videos and I guarantee someone will connect with you. Create An Engaging Channel TrailerWith the new channel design, YouTube gives content creators a great opportunity to create a trailer to share what your content is about. Keep your trailer under 90 seconds and show scenes from your other videos and provide a strong call to action of why a viewer should become a subscriber. If you are new and need a subscribers base in order gain more subscribers, you may first purchase subscriber from specific service provider. Hope that is insightful for you! Good Luck!

Optimize your title. Being able to distinguish the most important aspect of success on YouTube.  A great way to do this is to give your video an unusual name. This way, you will attract a lot of people to your channel based solely on curiosity. An odd title will play an important role in getting views that your channel needs to benefit from social proof. In a nutshell, learn how to write compelling, relevant and optimized titles. Technical Techniques for Success on YouTube Get thumbnails, for example.  During the second split when the viewer decides which video they will watch, your thumbnail may be the last game changer. This is a very small but important point to remember every time you upload a new video. Similarly, there are many small steps you can take to increase the number of subscribers to your channel. For example, end cards with large Subscriptions buttons can motivate viewers to subscribe to your channel in a subtle way. Use a strong call-to-action in your annotations. Near the end of your video, encourage viewers to subscribe to your channel. Never try to reach the ideal length for your video The ideal length of your YouTube Channel is unique to you. It depends on a lot of factors such as genre and even your presentation style.  Never listen to any of these tips. No one can tell you the ideal length of your YouTube video. Set the time that you feel is ideal. Something is not too long nor too short. You will be able to reach this balance when you create more than one video.

Apply these steps in every next video you'll upload: Get a specific and catchy title (Clickbait) of your video.Upload unique video or if doing on a common topic then make the best video out perform all other creators. Also you can add some new stuff to it to make it unique.Use the keywords and description. Insert keywords which will be used to search for your video. Also fill the description box with some hashtags and keywords.During the video or at the end remind the viewers to Subscribe your channel and LIKE the video just like I am telling you to Upvote the answer!Upload regularly, stick to schedule.If possible collaborate with other YouTubers(having more subscribers).If something very trending is happening related to the niche of your channel then be quick to make a video on it.MOST IMPORTANT: If you have the passion for becoming a YouTube content creator then you shouldn't be disappointed if in starting you have less subscribers and less views. Give 110% everytime to your content and then never be disappointed with the response and also do not get to obsessed with your response, just get through it and work more hard.The popular YouTube content creators like Technical Guruji, Harh Beniwal, Amit Bhadana, BB Ki Vines, Ashish Chanchalani, Technical Sagar, Pewdiepie, Shroud, Dynamo Gaming, Mortal, Carryminati and many more once had very less subscribers and not much views came to their videos. But what they did? Did they loose hope and quit? No, they had patience and worked hard! You will surely succeed, believe in yourself.

Getting more subscribers can seem like a difficult task, but I’ll share 10 tips to help you get more subscribers. 1. Post Useful Content Consistently This is one of the most difficult things to do as a content creator. If you take a look around YouTube you might think that every video under the sun has been created and that is most likely true, but you can put your own spin on a popular topic. For example, there are many “unboxing” tech videos…what if you created a “reboxing” and talk about the various components of tech while you put it back in the box? The key here is creativity and that will certainly boost subscriptions. 2. Name Your Videos Strategically One of the most difficult things is to name your video. You have the name in your head, but it may be something complex or too long. My rule is to keep it basic and use the YouTube autocomplete to name the video. There is nothing wrong with your video having the same name or something close to a popular video, as long as it’s relevant. 3. Spruce Up Your Channel Design Most visitors first impression of you is from your channel and your design. This is where visitors interact and get to know what you are about. Create a engaging header and show off your brand. 4. Show Your Lighter Side Lighten up and laugh at yourself. Bloopers make you more human and show something different than an ordinary talking head video. Also, switch up the video and catch your viewers off guard so they don’t know what to expect. 5. Shoot In Various Locations I believe that shooting in various locations can lead to more interest. I understand that may not be possible or you may have a set, but try to change a background or even use a green screen. Like the cliché says, “variety is the spice of life” so mix it up with your backgrounds and locations. 6. Create A Custom Thumbnail I have seen my subscriptions and views increase by adding this step. I use impact font that is seen on many internet photos to grab attention and I format the photo using Adobe Photoshop. 7. Use Annotations Annotations are those annoying things that pop up during videos, but they can be a content creator’s dream. I add annotations to every video and make it easy by creating a link for them to subscribe. This is extra work, but once you see your subscription rate increase you will continue to add them to every video. 8. Ask For Subscribers This is very basic. At the end of every video ask viewers to “like” and subscribe to your channel. You should also tell them why they should subscribe, for example if you are a DIY Home Improvement channel I would say, “subscribe for my DIY projects, tricks and insider tips delivered to you weekly.” Remember, be careful what you ask for, because you might get it. 9. Be Yourself You are the best you—you can be. Being on camera was difficult for me at first because I compared myself to others who are natural on camera talent then I realized, “I just have to be me.” Let your personality shine in your videos and I guarantee someone will connect with you. 10. Create An Engaging Channel Trailer With the new channel design, YouTube gives content creators a great opportunity to create a trailer to share what your content is about. Have you ever attended a movie without viewing a trailer? Not me, because you want to see what it is about. Keep your trailer under 90 seconds and show scenes from your other videos and provide a strong call to action of why a viewer should become a subscriber.

Being Youtuber myself, I can tell you that it’s not easy to gain subscribers. The very first thing before anything you would have to do is create quality content and focus on the content and not the subscribers. Second, be consistent. If you are posting videos whenever you feel like than trust me it won’t work. You need to develop a schedule, maybe one video every week or 2 weeks. but if you can make more than 1 video every week than do it. But do remember to focus on the content, I can’t stress this enough QUALITY > QUANTITY. Once you have enough content, you would need to promote it. Start by sharing it your friends and families. Promote your videos on other social medias eg : facebook, reddit, twitter etc. Remember you are a brand and you would have to do promotion to get it out there for other people to find you. Lastly, Don’t give up. It might take you months or years for your content to be discovered but if you are consistent and producing quality content. Then people will stick around and watch your videos. The key is to not gain subscribers but FOLLOWERS. GOODLUCK. P.S This is my channel : Merc

There is nothing more satisfying than hitting a milestone with your videos. One important one is your first 1,000 subscribers. This is important because YouTube offers live streaming once you have achieved this milestone and you have an account in good standing (Since the publishing of this post there has been a change: YouTube now offers live streaming for free for verified non-profit entities. Instead of needing 1,000 subscribers you now need 100 subscribers.) Getting more subscribers can seem like a difficult task, but I’ll share 10 tips to help you get your first 1,000 subscribers. 1. Post Useful Content Consistently This is one of the most difficult things to do as a content creator. If you take a look around YouTube you might think that every video under the sun has been created and that is most likely true, but you can put your own spin on a popular topic. For example, there are many “unboxing” tech videos…what if you created a “reboxing” and talk about the various components of tech while you put it back in the box? The key here is creativity and that will certainly boost subscriptions. 2. Name Your Videos Strategically One of the most difficult things is to name your video. You have the name in your head, but it may be something complex or too long. My rule is to keep it basic and use the YouTube autocomplete to name the video. There is nothing wrong with your video having the same name or something close to a popular video, as long as it’s relevant. 3. Spruce Up Your Channel Design Most visitors first impression of you is from your channel and your design. This is where visitors interact and get to know what you are about. Create a engaging header and show off your brand. On my channel, we were intentional about our design making it fit into our overall branding strategy. The key takeaway is to design with purpose. 4. Show Your Lighter Side Lighten up and laugh at yourself. Bloopers make you more human and show something different than an ordinary talking head video. Also, switch up the video and catch your viewers off guard so they don’t know what to expect. 5. Shoot In Various Locations I believe that shooting in various locations can lead to more interest. I understand that may not be possible or you may have a set, but try to change a background or even use a green screen. Like the cliché says, “variety is the spice of life” so mix it up with your backgrounds and locations. 6. Create A Custom Thumbnail I have seen my subscriptions and views increase by adding this step. I use impact font that is seen on many internet photos to grab attention and I format the photo using Adobe Photoshop. I usually title the photo thumbnail differently than the video because when people are scrolling through other videos to view, they can easily tell what my video is about. 7. Use Annotations Annotations are those annoying things that pop up during videos, but they can be a content creator’s dream. I add annotations to every video and make it easy by creating a link for them to subscribe. This is extra work, but once you see your subscription rate increase you will continue to add them to every video. 8. Ask For Subscribers This is very basic. At the end of every video ask viewers to “like” and subscribe to your channel. You should also tell them why they should subscribe, for example if you are a DIY Home Improvement channel I would say, “subscribe for my DIY projects, tricks and insider tips delivered to you weekly.” Remember, be careful what you ask for, because you might get it. 9. Be Yourself You are the best you—you can be. Being on camera was difficult for me at first because I compared myself to others who are natural on camera talent then I realized, “I just have to be me.” Let your personality shine in your videos and I guarantee someone will connect with you. 10. Create An Engaging Channel Trailer With the new channel design, YouTube gives content creators a great opportunity to create a trailer to share what your content is about. Have you ever attended a movie without viewing a trailer? Not me, because you want to see what it is about. Keep your trailer under 90 seconds and show scenes from your other videos and provide a strong call to action of why a viewer should become a subscriber. Keep people coming back by putting some effort into your videos. Did you notice I didn’t mention any technical details about lighting, audio and composition? This is because I assume you should know that already. The more comfortable you are on camera the more subscribers you can get. It may take a while, but you can do it.

Two ways to get your channel to One Million Subscribers Okay, so you will need to put in a lot of time, hard work, and consistency. All of which are great tips I might add but, sadly when it comes to Youtube it is not that simple. Example: The most recent example that may take you for a loop would be a new YouTuber who hit 1 Million subscribers after her first two videos. She goes by the name of Jennelle Eliana. Once her video was promoted on the trending page people took a liking to it and decided to watch. It is unclear to say how or why she made it on to the trending page with her first two videos but, that is how her channel took off. Example: Mr. Beast, They used a classic formula from the earlier days of youtube. The community hadn't seen this style in the spotlight for a few years and they brought it back. By no means is this a reason to hate on them or others, it is great to see someone different on the trending pages rather than the usual faces one may see when they first click on the website. This is merely an example of why getting your channel to one million subscribers can be a tricky and strange process. I will now present a few tried and true ways to get your channel to one million subscribers organically then I will list other ways that may not be as practical.  Organic Growth: Make sure you enjoy making the videos you create.Post consistentlyThis could be once a day, once a week, or once a month and all these methods have been proven to work by successful channels on Youtube.Promote yourself to those who already know you, don’t be too pushy about it though. Just keep letting them know casually that you are making videos and you’d appreciate it if they supported you and gave you feedback to help you grow.As you grow engage find ways to engage with your audience however you see fit.Have Patience and enjoy your journeyYou will have to develop a tough skin because the internet, as we know, can be brutal at times. Don’t allow “haters” to take away your light.Non-Practical Growth: If you happen to have an abundance of money and a few connections you could buy your view count to make it appear as if you have a huge audience. This is what many artists in the music industry do when they release a new music video or song on Youtube in order to get their video placed at the top. This method does not always work because there are other variables that come into play as well.Go to all of the biggest events and Cons or wherever other well-known YouTubers are in an attempt to make a collaboration video with them. Needless to say, this could also be difficult.3. Try to make viral videos. This is also difficult because viral videos are random and you never know what will work and what won’t. No one could have seen the Look at all those chickens video coming. lol

1. Be Yourself Be yourself in the video because that's what you're comfortable with and no one wants to watch a fake. Post original content and try to stand out from other YouTubers, without being a fake. People love it when they're watching someone who's real and doesn't fake happiness for the sake of the video. They'd rather watch real emotions, or...at least I would rather watch real emotions. 1. Be Consistent 2. Be Consistent You need to have a set schedule of how often you post your videos, preferably weekly. 3. Edit In order to make a good video you need to edit out anything that would ruin the video, and add some things that would make it better such as: Intro, endcard(at the end of each video there should be a platform where you promote/advertise your previous video(s) and prompt the audience to subscribe to your channel),  bloopers that could entertain the audience(at the end of the video), cool transitions(but not too many), etc. 4. Advertise Promote your content on all the social medias you have, and tell your friends and family about your channel(If you're comfortable with that). It's the quickest way to get subscribers. If people you know are subscribed, they'll more likely share your content than those who don't know you at all.

response.answer_text: It’s usually pretty easy to gain subscribers in the short term. Keeping them is the hard part. There are actually many ways to get subscribers fast. One of my favorite ways back in the day was to go to a popular YouTuber’s channel and participate in the comments section. I wouldn’t beg or even ask for subscribers, but I would go down the comment list and just chat with people. Eventually, some of them would go check out my channel! Another easy way to gain subscribers is to make friends! If you have friends in the real world that you hang out with, ask them to subscribe. Maybe go find a community of gamers and make friends there. Friends are always an easy way to gain subscribers. If you really just want to increase that sub number without increasing the number of views your videos get, go do Sub4Sub. This way you can sub to peoples channels and they will sub back to yours. They might not watch any of your videos, but if all you care about is the sub number, then you’re good! OF course, you’ll never become a successful YouTuber by just increasing your subscriber count… To be successful, you need to grow your audience! Your audience consists of all of the people who actually sit down and watch your videos. Some members of your audience may be subscribers, and some may not be. The important distinction to make is that not all subscribers are audience members. In fact, using programs like Sub4Sub is a great way to increase your subscriber count without gaining any new audience members. This is how you could have 5,000 subscribers and only 10 views per video. Growing your audience is not easy. It requires a consistent upload schedule and entertaining videos to keep your viewers coming back for more. Good luck my friend. Keep at it and you can do it!

If you want people to subscribe to your YouTube channel, you must create some buzz around you. In order to get this buzz, you have to do a number of things. Make sure your channel contains only high-quality, videos which can be clearly viewed and heard smoothly (No one wants to watch a dark video).Create interesting content, select the niche that works for you, and create multiple videos for this niche. Do something different in your video to attract an audience (if you'll be like everyone else it's boring ...)Choose high-quality images to promote your videos and your channel!Publish your channel and a talk about your videos on your social media, give a link to your YouTube on any social platform you use - the easiest audience is your friends and family!In each video, add a link to another video of yours, describe your videos, add a link to a playlist containing multiple of your videos, promote your video in any way possible. Respond to people who create videos from the same niche as yours, and encourage them to watch your videos, to create a shared video, and more ...You can also buy some subscribers to get more subs in a natural way, what do I mean? When you have a large number of subscribers, people will subscribe to you more easily - they will assume that if other people do so why not? Psychological effect. (There is a blog that explains it name getfans, io they have a page with an explanation about buying subscriptions and the effect of it - Buy YouTube Subscribers )Good luck!

There are a lot of ways available to get more & more YouTube Subscribers. Just need to implement these properly. Here I am going to share 15 best strategies to get a lot of youtube subscribers fast.  If you are looking for the easiest ways for this, then I want to say that nothing is easy. The methods I am going to tell are easy to see, but it is a bit difficult to apply continuously. But it is also true that nothing is complicated. It may be you have heard earlier about these strategies that I have mentioned here, but I am going to introduce these in a different way. If you are ready, then let's move forward without wasting any more time. 1. Create and Post Highly Engaging and Watchable Content: I know that now you will be thinking that it is not so hard but wait a bit it is not so easy also, for that you need to do a lot. To make your video engaging and watchable, you have to adopt the following methods. 1.1 Do Research More & More on your Topic: It is the first step to making a nice attractive video. Watch more and more youtube videos and read a lot of articles related to your topic, and note all the main points from these which you want to add in your video.  It means you collect more & more information for your video as it is good to provide as much information as possible in your video. It also attracts your audience to come back to your channel. 1.2 Make a powerful script: It is also a part of creating an engageable content. I know that many of you do not like writing scripts before making videos. But believe it is a necessary process. Why? Because when you make a script and make your video on its basis, then you lose the chances of wandering from your rhythm, as well as you can show your story in the same powerful way as you thought earlier.  It keeps you at the center point of your video always when you create. By doing so, your viewers feel that you are providing them with full information and the chance of it increases that they subscribe to your channel. 1.3 Shoot your video like a professional: As far as video shooting is concerned, you need to bring professionalism into it. Now you are thinking that how you can make your video like a professional? Do you have to buy an expensive camera and lighting system for it? My answer is a big NO. Nowadays the quality of the camera coming on your mobile phone is close to a much more expensive DSLR. You can prepare a good lighting system using some old things at home. And if it comes to the mic so you can use your mobile headphone like a mic. If you are thinking of shooting a video at your home then you can set up your studio like this:  1.4 Make sure that the first 30 seconds of your video is the most attractive: The first 30 seconds of any video is its most important part, and it ensures that how your entire video will be. It is the time when your YouTube subscribers or visitors can leave your channel. So try to make the first 30 seconds of your video as attractive as possible so that the focus of your visitors is concentrated in your video. 2. Limit the length of the video within 5 minutes: However, the length of any video depends on its content. If you want to make a video with a demo on a topic, then it is clear that the video will be long. As far as it comes to the ideal length of a YouTube video, the best length of a YouTube video is less than 5 minutes, because you will see that such videos perform well on YouTube, which are less than 5 minutes. ComScore also presented a report in January 2014, in which it clarified that the average length of most YouTube videos that performed well was 4.4 minutes. So apparently this length is perfect for a youtube video. If you are thinking about an ideal length, then the answer is in front of you. You can understand it well through this infographic:  Source: Buffer Blog 3. Create Eye-catching Thumbnails: You all know that how thumbnail plays a big role for any YouTube video. It is known to the world that if the thumbnail of the video is so attractive, then the chance of watching your video will increase. Naturally, this will increase your subscriber as well. An example of the ideal thumbnail:  Let's understand it through a short story: suppose, you have two books and both are of the same category. The cover of the first book is very well decorated. It looks like it will be the best book in its category. On the other hand, the cover of the second book is made very simple. Now it's your turn, tell me which book you would like to read? I know that you would like to read the first one. It also applies to the thumbnail of your video as well. Well, since Youtube exploded with gaming channels it's very hard to get good recognition in that space. But it's not impossible, what you are missing is : Intro, you really need to get an intro, it doesn't need to be fancy expensive intro but you should have it.“Get to the point”, First explain the game in short words, fast, simple and to the point, later on, if you want to go in depths, you can but it's not necessary. A lot of people just want a simple review to see if the game is good or not.Don't explain the gameplay but rather try to score and categorize, your gameplay. example: Graphics, Physics, Story, Engine, etc…Scoring should be based on, either previous games of the same production or on similar games. You can even compare categories with other games.At the end of the video, create a conclusion and give it an overall score which was based on previous categories.Also, you can watch some of Gameranx videos and see how they are doing it.And for god, sake throws out those tasteless jokes, what are you 5 years old, remember you are trying to make people like you and your content, so you cant say whatever you want, and whenever you want it. If you really want to create a channel where you could throw in some jokes like that, do that later on when you have more subscribers and do it like an experiment to see how they would react. Because you are not making videos for adults only here, there will be children watching your reviews also, so be careful what you say because you can get banned very easily.

There is only one proper way to do this and that is by buying ad space. Let me explain. When YT sees you have uploaded a new video it tests that video out on a group of people that it thinks may be interested in it. If you have 10k fake/bought followers then what YT sees is that you made a video that none of your followers are interested in. This causes the video to be suppressed and your channel to stop growing. However there is a way to legally buy real followers who will engage with you. Ads - and I would start with Facebook. There are many strategies here but one of my favorites is to offer a free gift (we run a number of online stores so this is what we usually use to find a gift). The ad is for a chance to win the gift - all they have to do is subscribe to me… on whatever platform, email list, or channel I’m promoting. If you engage this group properly, have a good gift that they like, etc then you can get some great followers this way. One important lesson we’ve learned while doing this: be super specific about trying to engage people who are really going to be interested in your content. If you don’t then you’ll still get follows but many of them will also be low quality followers who do not engage with your content much.

Video content is leading the way in the content marketing scene. YouTube is currently the leading platform for video blogging (vlogging), video sharing, and video marketing. It is a free platform offered by Google, and many (including me) love it. Facebook and Twitter have recently stepped into the video marketing game, but they still fall way short of having the kind of impact that YouTube has. Be consistent: The “one-and-done” approach does not work on YouTube. If you want the views and the traffic, you need to be posting and updating your content consistently for best results. Have a planned and proper schedule.Provide value: If your video fails to provide any real value to the end user, don’t be surprised when it doesn’t get any real views. Each video needs to deliver your best content.Be remarkable: Today, it’s not enough to be posting weekly videos with your tips and content. You must convey your content in an engaging and entertaining format. Do something creative and unique that separates you from the rest. In short, your videos need to be remarkable. The biggest sin is to be boring. How can your videos be the opposite of boring?#1: Ask for Subscribers The simplest way to begin increasing your subscriber count is to start asking for it in your videos. Never assume that your viewer will subscribe just by watching your video. In your videos, give your audience a compelling call to action and ask them to click the “Subscribe” button. Ask them to subscribe.Tell them why to do it.For example: “To stay up to date with my latest videos, make sure to subscribe to this YouTube channel by clicking the subscribe button” #2: Use Annotations Annotations are the little colorful sticky notes that people paste all over their videos once they’ve been uploaded to YouTube. If you use this tool right, then it can be a great way to add subscribers. There are two effective uses for annotations that I recommend: Call-to-action annotation: Add a “speech bubble“ annotation to all of your old and existing videos asking the viewers to subscribe.#3: Add a YouTube Widget to Your Blog If you already have a website/ blog that is getting traffic, this is a great opportunity to leverage those visitors and make them subscribe to your channel with the click of a button. If you are using wordpress, then there are lots of plugins available to do so. #4: Leverage Featured Channels A great method for increasing your reach and harvesting subscribers is to strategically partner with other YouTube content-creators. Directly on your YouTube channel page is an option to add other “Featured Channels” of those “YouTubers” you like and recommend. When you get other channels that have a similar audience to feature you, you can expect to see new viewers coming your way very quickly! Also Create a plan and script for your videos.Produce highly engaging contentHave a consistent upload scheduleIncrease your upload frequencyoptimize your video titlePersonalize video thumbnailsCreate an engaging channel trailerMake use of ‘Call to Action’ annotationsLimit the videos to under 5 minutes (go for something more than 5 minutes if it is really needed, else stick to under 5 minute plan)Optimize your video descriptionMake the most of meta tagsInteract with your fan baseArrange some giveawaysAsk your friends to watch, like, comment and also share your videos with as many people as possible.

Here are a few general tips to improve your channel and videos, and as result more subscribers. Try and keep your uploads to a schedule. Viewers will appreciate this and as a result be more likely to subscribe.People would prefer longer 10 minute plus videos every week/month etc, than shorter, more frequent videos.SoundIt’s important that you invest in a decent microphone so people can clearly hear your voice.Try and reduce background noise as much as possible.If you've written yourself a script, make sure your voice sounds lively/engaging. Don't read off it out of shot, despite your best efforts people will notice this. Try and practice what your going to say beforehand.VideoI know it's quicker to upload in lower quality, but viewers really appreciate it if you upload your videos in at least 720p.Make sure the camera is steady.If there's something distracting in the background, move it or film elsewhere.Try and stick to a theme in your content. If someone subscribes for your gaming content, they won't want to watch you go shopping.If you make a mistake in your recording, film it again.I hope this helps and good luck in your YouTube career.

Are you familiar with Evan Carmichael? He has over 2 million subscribers. One of the best tips I got from this video below was that everyone talks about search optimisation, when instead we should focus on getting in SUGGESTED videos. Because although people might search for an initial video, they then look in the sidebar or the recommended videos (or even the homepage) for most other videos. To get shown in suggested more we need: * To have a strong video ending where we tell viewers to go watch a similar videos of ours that’s connected. Don’t say “thanks for watching etc etc” or you lose everyone before your end card. Send them to a specific relevant video and youtube will form the connection. * Have consistent thumbnails - have a theme or design or closeup of your face they can recognise even on small mobile screen. Otherwise people don’t know it’s you even if you get in sidebar! * Focus on watch time as the key metric to get youtube to promote your videos more. It’s actually better to have LESS VIEWS but more watch time. Having a strong hook in those first 15 seconds is crucial for this. * Many more strategies in the video below, but definitely aiming to get in suggested videos will massively boost your channel growth and subscriber count.

1. Post Useful Content Consistently This is one of the most difficult things to do as a content creator. If you take a look around YouTube you might think that every video under the sun has been created and that is most likely true, but you can put your own spin on a popular topic. For example, there are many “unboxing” tech videos…what if you created a “reboxing” and talk about the various components of tech while you put it back in the box? The key here is creativity and that will certainly boost subscriptions. 2. Name Your Videos Strategically One of the most difficult things is to name your video. You have the name in your head, but it may be something complex or too long. My rule is to keep it basic and use the YouTube autocomplete to name the video. There is nothing wrong with your video having the same name or something close to a popular video, as long as it’s relevant. 3. Spruce Up Your Channel Design Most visitors first impression of you is from your channel and your design. This is where visitors interact and get to know what you are about. Create a engaging header and show off your brand. On my channel, we were intentional about our design making it fit into our overall branding strategy. The key takeaway is to design with purpose.
